verses.kjv: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
verses.web: Oh that you would tear the heavens, that you would come down, that the mountains might quake at your presence.
verses.ct: If only you would tear open the heavens and come down! The mountains would tremble at your presence,

verses.kjv: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!
verses.web: As when fire kindles the brushwood, and the fire causes the water to boil; Make your name known to your adversaries, that the nations may tremble at your presence!
verses.ct: like fire setting brushwood ablaze, like flames making water boil. Come and make your name known to your enemies so that nations shake with fear before you!

verses.kjv: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.
verses.web: When you did awesome things which we didn’t look for, you came down, and the mountains quaked at your presence.
verses.ct: In the past, you did terrifying things we never expected. You came down, and the mountains trembled at your presence.

verses.kjv: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.
verses.web: For from of old men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, nor has the eye seen a God besides you, who works for him who waits for him.
verses.ct: Since the beginning of the world, no one has heard, no ear has picked up, no eye has seen any God besides you, who acts on behalf of those who wait for him.

verses.kjv: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.
verses.web: You meet him who rejoices and does righteousness, those who remember you in your ways. Behold, you were angry, and we sinned. We have been in sin for a long time. Shall we be saved?
verses.ct: You welcome those who gladly do what is right, those who remember you and follow your ways. But look — you were angry because we kept sinning. We've been in sin for so long. Can we still be saved?

verses.kjv: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
verses.web: For we have all become like one who is unclean, and all our righteousness is like a polluted garment. We all fade like a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, take us away.
verses.ct: All of us have become like something unclean, and even our best efforts at righteousness are like filthy rags. We all wither like a leaf, and our sins carry us away like the wind.

verses.kjv: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.
verses.web: There is no one who calls on your name, who stirs himself up to take hold of you; for you have hidden your face from us, and have consumed us by means of our iniquities.
verses.ct: No one calls on your name anymore. No one reaches out to hold on to you. You have hidden your face from us and let our sins destroy us.

verses.kjv: But now, O LORD, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.
verses.web: But now, LORD, you are our Father. We are the clay and you our potter. We all are the work of your hand.
verses.ct: But LORD, you are still our Father. We are the clay, and you are the potter. Every one of us is shaped by your hand.

verses.kjv: Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.
verses.web: Don’t be furious, LORD. Don’t remember iniquity forever. Look and see, we beg you, we are all your people.
verses.ct: Don't stay furious with us, LORD. Don't hold our sins against us forever. Please, look at us — we are all your people.

verses.kjv: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
verses.web: Your holy cities have become a wilderness. Zion has become a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
verses.ct: Your holy cities have become a wasteland. Zion is a wilderness. Jerusalem lies in ruins.

verses.kjv: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
verses.web: Our holy and our beautiful house where our fathers praised you is burned with fire. All our pleasant places are laid waste.
verses.ct: Our holy and beautiful temple — the place where our ancestors praised you — has been burned to the ground. Everything we treasured has been destroyed.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O LORD? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
verses.web: Will you hold yourself back for these things, LORD? Will you keep silent and punish us very severely?
verses.ct: After all of this, LORD, will you still hold back? Will you stay silent and let us suffer beyond what we can bear?
